title: Gustavo Peña
text:
Gustavo Peña Velasco (22 November 1942 – 19 January 2021) was a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> and manager.
Life.
Born in <a href="Talpa%20de%20Allende">Talpa de Allende</a>, Peña moved to <a href="Guadalajara%2C%20Jalisco">Guadalajara, Jalisco</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> with his parents when he was young.
Gustavo Peña died of <a href="COVID-19">COVID-19</a> on 19 January 2021, in <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>, at age 78, during the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Mexico">COVID-19 pandemic in Mexico</a>.
Career.
He began playing football with local side <a href="CD%20Oro">CD Oro</a>. He played for nearly twenty years in the <a href="Liga%20MX%23Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20Mexico">Primera División</a> with Oro, <a href="Cruz%20Azul">Cruz Azul</a>, <a href="CF%20Monterrey">Monterrey</a> and <a href="Club%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Laguna">Club de Fútbol Laguna</a>.
He earned 82 caps and scored 3 goals for the <a href="Mexico%20national%20football%20team">Selección de fútbol de México</a> (Mexico national team) from 1961 to 1974, and captained the team in <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> (<a href="1966%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1966</a> and <a href="1970%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1970</a>) tournaments.
Honours.
Manager.
Leones Negros
